BiblioData.Title: Methods, compositions and blends for forming articles having improved environmental stress crack resistance
BiblioData.Abstract: Several processes for the manufacture of thin-walled tubes are described, including: injection moulding an article and annealing the article, injection moulding a blend of a polymer and a high melt flow polymer, injection moulding a blend of a polymer and nanoparticles or nanocomposites. Using nanoparticles to improve ESCR and/or tear resistance of a polymer or blend is also disclosed.

Claims.P: 1. A process for the manufacture of flexible, thin-walled articles comprising the steps of injection moulding a polymer blend having an MFI > 10 and comprising at least one polymer wherein said polymer includes a polypropylene having varying tacticity within its structure.
2. A process according to claim 1, wherein the polymer having varying tacticity, has a tacticity which varies within the range of between 25 and 60 % of [mmmm] pentad concentration.
3. A process according to claim 1, wherein the blend comprises at least two polymers, with at least one polymer having a higher crystallinity than the at least one other polymer.
4. A process according to claim 3, wherein the at least one polymer is made from the same monomer(s) as the at least one other polymer.
5. A process according to claim 3, in which as least one polymer is a polyethylene polymer.
6. A process according to claim 4, wherein both polymers are made from propylene monomer.

7. A process according to claim 3, wherein the blend comprises a) a polymer comprising stereospecific polypropylene of greater crystallinity (XPP) and b) a copolymer of propylene and at least one C2, C4-C20 [alpha]-olefin of lesser crystallinity (SXPP), and the blend comprises between 1% and 95% by weight of the XPP and a SXPP with greater than 65% by weight propylene.

8. A process according to claim 7, wherein the blend comprises between 1% and 95% by weight of an isotactic polypropylene and an ethylene propylene copolymer with greater than 65 % by weight propylene, preferably greater than 80 % by weight propylene.
9. A process according to claim 7 or claim 8, wherein the XPP and the SXPP have the same tacticity.
10. A process according to claim 1, further including annealing the injection moulded thin-walled article.
11. A process according to claim 1, wherein at least one polymer of the blend has an MFI of greater than 100.

12. A process according to claim 1, wherein the blend comprises (a) 1% to 99% of at least one isotactic, syndiotactic or atactic polypropylene homopolymer or [alpha]-olefin copolymer and (b) 99 % to 1 % of at least one of an ethylene, propylene and/or butene copolymer.
